snippet: The Libyan force would help combat Islamic extremists, like those who killed the American ambassador last month, and help the country’s army counter fractious militias.
abstract: Pentagon and State Department are speeding up efforts to help Libyan government create commando force to combat Islamic extremists like those who killed J Christopher Stevens, former American ambassador to Libya, and to help counter country's fractious militias.

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Tripoli, Libya.

lead_paragraph: The Libyan force would help combat Islamic extremists, like those who killed the American ambassador last month, and help the country’s army counter fractious militias.

headline.seo: U.S. to Help Create Libyan Commando Force
headline.main: U.S. to Help Create an Elite Libyan Force to Combat Islamic Extremists
headline.print_headline: U. S. to Help Create an Elite Libyan Force to Combat Islamic Extremists
